definition: 100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient
sentences.chinese: 我雖然靠着基督能放膽吩咐你合宜的事。

sentences.english: Judge in yourselves: is it comely that a woman pray unto God uncovered?
sentences.chinese: 你們自己審察，女人禱告神，不蒙着頭，是合宜的嗎。

sentences.english: For early Christians, it was appropriate to have both colors in the holly wreath.
sentences.chinese: 對初代基督徒而言，冬青花環有這兩種顏色相當合宜。

sentences.english: Lovers need it to cover inconvenient accidents.
sentences.chinese: 愛人們需要它來掩蓋很不合宜的事故。

sentences.english: That is the second level of humaneness, and is in accord with principle.
sentences.chinese: 這是仁愛的第二層發揮，合理合宜。

sentences.english: They still continue to buy "proper" books, too, printed on good paper and bound between hard covers.
sentences.chinese: 他們始終青睞“合宜”的書，如紙張好的硬皮書。

sentences.english: It is not at all advisable to use items wrapped in plastics during feast-offerings.
sentences.chinese: 在薈供時使用塑料包裝的供物是一點都不合宜的。

sentences.english: How appropriate that all the efforts of man to establish his own form of government or rulership have failed.
sentences.chinese: 人建立自己的政府和統治的努力失敗了，這是合宜的。
我認爲這是不合宜的行爲。

sentences.english: Cabin crews are well-groomed and possess professional appearance.
sentences.chinese: 機艙服務員打扮合宜及擁有專業的形象。

sentences.english: The appropriate horticulture is a new idea of the international ornamental horticulture.
sentences.chinese: “合宜園藝”是國際觀賞園藝發展的新理念。

sentences.english: We know that the law is good if one uses it properly.
sentences.chinese: 我們知道律法原是好的，只要人用得合宜。

sentences.english: It does not behave unbecomingly and does not seek its own things;
sentences.chinese: 不做不合宜的事，不求自己的益處。

sentences.english: It's appropriate to congratulate new parents on their new addition.
sentences.chinese: 向生嬰兒的父母親恭賀新生兒也是合宜的。

sentences.english: But we know that the law is good, if a man use it lawfully;
sentences.chinese: 我們知道律法原是好的，只要人用得合宜。

sentences.english: It is not fitting for a fool to live in luxury- how much worse for a slave to rule over princes!
sentences.chinese: 愚昧人宴樂度日，是不合宜的，何況僕人管轄王子呢？

definition: timely/at the right moment/appropriate to the occasion/opportune/to fit current fashion
to decide/to determine/established practice/(dialect) firmly resolved (to do sth)
conforming to a pattern/variant of 合適|合适[he2 shi4]
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
not stick to/not confine oneself to/whatever
